100.2: Serve the LORD with gladness; come before his presence with joy.
100.3: Know ye that the LORD he is God; it is he that has made us and not we ourselves; we are his people and the sheep of his pasture.
100.4: Enter into his gates with thanksgiving and into his courts with praise; be thankful unto him and bless his name.
100.5: For the LORD is good; his mercy is everlasting; and his truth endures to all generations.

101.1: I will sing of mercy and judgment; unto thee, O LORD, will I sing.
101.2: When thou shalt come unto me, I will walk in the way of perfection and understand. I will walk in the midst of my house in the perfection of my heart.
101.3: I will set nothing of Belial before my eyes: I hate the work of those that betray; it shall not cleave to me.
101.4: A perverse heart shall depart from me; I will not know a wicked person.
101.5: Whosoever secretly slanders his neighbour, I will cut off; he that has a high look and a proud heart I will not suffer.
101.6: My eyes shall be upon the faithful of the land, that they may dwell with me; he that walks in the way of perfection, he shall serve me.
101.7: He that works deceit shall not dwell within my house; he that tells lies shall not tarry in my sight.
101.8: I will early destroy all the wicked of the land, that I may cut off all the workers of iniquity from the city of the LORD.

102.1: Hear my prayer, O LORD, and let my cry come unto thee.
102.2: Hide not thy face from me in the day when I am in trouble; incline thine ear unto me; in the day when I call, answer me speedily.
102.3: For my days are consumed like smoke, and my bones are burned as in a hearth.
102.4: My heart is smitten and withered like grass so that I forget to eat my bread.
102.5: By reason of the voice of my groaning, my bones cleave to my skin.
102.6: I am like a pelican of the wilderness; I am like an owl of the desert.
102.7: I watch and am as a sparrow alone upon the house top.
102.8: My enemies reproach me all the day, and those that are mad against me are sworn against me.
102.9: For I have eaten ashes like bread and mingled my drink with weeping,
102.10: because of thine indignation and thy wrath; for thou hast lifted me up and cast me down.
102.11: My days are like a shadow that declines, and I am withered like grass.
102.12: But thou, O LORD, shalt endure for ever and thy remembrance unto all generations.
102.13: Thou shalt arise and have mercy upon Zion; for the time to favour her, the set time, is come.
102.14: For thy slaves love her stones and have compassion on the dust thereof.
102.15: So the Gentiles shall fear the name of the LORD, and all the kings of the earth thy glory
102.16: because the LORD shall have built up Zion, and he shall be seen in his glory.
102.17: He shall have regarded the prayer of those who are alone and destitute and not despised their prayer.
102.18: This shall be written for the generation to come, and the people who shall be created shall praise JAH.
102.19: For he has looked down from the height of his sanctuary; from the heavens the LORD beheld the earth
102.20: to hear the groaning of the prisoner; to loose those that are appointed to death,
102.21: that they might declare the name of the LORD in Zion and his praise in Jerusalem,
102.22: when the people are gathered together as one and the kingdoms, to serve the LORD.
102.23: He weakened my strength in the way; he shortened my days.
102.24: I said, O my God, do not cut me off in the midst of my days; thy years are from generation to generation.
102.25: Of old thou hast laid the foundation of the earth; and the heavens are the work of thy hands.
102.26: They shall perish, but thou shalt endure: yea, all of them shall wax old like a garment; as a vesture thou shalt change them, and they shall be changed:
102.27: But thou art the same, and thy years shall have no end.
102.28: The sons of thy slaves shall continue, and their seed shall be established before thee.

103.1: Bless the LORD, O my soul, and all that is within me, bless the name of his holiness.
103.2: Bless the LORD, O my soul, and forget not all his benefits:
103.3: Who forgives all thine iniquities; who heals all thy diseases;
103.4: who redeems thy life from destruction; who crowns thee with mercy and compassion;
103.5: who satisfies thy mouth with good things so that thy youth is renewed like the eagle’s.
103.6: The LORD executes righteousness and justice unto all that suffer violence.
103.7: He made known his ways unto Moses, his acts unto the sons of Israel.
103.8: The LORD is merciful and gracious, slow to anger, and plenteous in mercy.
103.9: He will not always chide, neither will he keep his anger for ever.
103.10: He has not dealt with us after our sins, nor rewarded us according to our iniquities.
103.11: For as the heavens are high above the earth so does he increase his mercy over those that fear him.
103.12: As far as the east is from the west, so far has he removed our rebellions from us.
103.13: Like as a father has mercy upon his children, so the LORD has mercy upon those that fear him.
103.14: For he knows our frame; he remembers that we are dust.
103.15: As for man, his days are as grass; as an open flower of the field, so he blossoms.
103.16: For the wind passes over it, and it is gone, and its place shall know it no more.
103.17: But the mercy of the LORD is from everlasting to everlasting upon those that fear him, and his righteousness unto the children’s children,
103.18: to such as keep his covenant and to those that remember his commandments to do them.
103.19: The LORD has prepared his throne in the heavens, and his kingdom rules over all.
103.20: Bless the LORD, ye his angels, valiant and strong, that do his commandments, hearkening unto the voice of his word.
103.21: Bless ye the LORD, all ye his hosts, ye ministers of his, that do his pleasure.
103.22: Bless the LORD, all his works in all places of his dominion: bless the LORD, O my soul.

104.1: Bless the LORD, O my soul. O LORD my God, thou art very great; thou art clothed with honour and majesty,
104.2: who dost cover thyself with light as with a garment, who stretchest out the heavens like a curtain,
104.3: who dost establish his chambers between the waters, who makes the clouds his chariot, who walks upon the wings of the wind,
104.4: who makes his angels spirits, his ministers a flaming fire,
104.5: who laid the foundations of the earth, that it should not be moved by any age.
104.6: Thou didst cover it with the deep as with a garment; the waters stood above the mountains.
104.7: At thy rebuke they fled; at the voice of thy thunder they hasted away.
104.8: The mountains were exposed; they descended through the valleys unto the place which thou hast founded for them.
104.9: Thou hast set a bound that they may not pass over, that they not turn again to cover the earth.
104.10: Thou art he who sends the springs into the valleys, which run among the mountains.
104.11: They give drink to every beast of the field; the wild asses quench their thirst.
104.12: Next to them the fowls of the heavens have their habitation; they sing among the leaves.
104.13: He waters the mountains from his chambers; the earth is satisfied with the fruit of thy works.
104.14: He causes the hay to grow for the cattle and grass for the service of man, that he may bring forth bread out of the earth
104.15: and wine that makes glad the heart of man, making his face to shine with oil and bread which sustains man’s heart.
104.16: The trees of the LORD are satisfied; the cedars of Lebanon, which he has planted,
104.17: that the birds may make their nests there: the stork makes her house among the fir trees.
104.18: The high mountains are a refuge for the wild goats, and the rocks for the conies.
104.19: He appointed the moon for times and seasons; the sun knows his going down.
104.20: Thou makest darkness, and it is night, wherein all the beasts of the forest move.
104.21: The young lions roar after their prey and seek their food from God.
104.22: The sun arises, they withdraw and lay themselves down in their dens.
104.23: Man goes forth unto his work and to his labour until the evening.
104.24: O LORD, how manifold are thy works! in wisdom thou hast made them all; the earth is full of thy riches.
104.25: So is this great and wide sea, wherein are innumerable creeping things, both small and great beasts.
104.26: There go the ships; there is that leviathan, whom thou didst make to play therein.
104.27: These wait all upon thee, that thou may give them their food in due season.
104.28: Thou givest unto them, they gather; thou openest thine hand, they are filled with good.
104.29: Thou hidest thy face, they are troubled; thou takest away their spirit, they cease to exist and return to their dust.
104.30: Thou sendest forth thy spirit, they are created; and thou renewest the face of the earth.
104.31: Let the glory of the LORD endure for ever; let the LORD rejoice in his works.
104.32: He looks on the earth, and it trembles: he touches the mountains, and they smoke.
104.33: I will sing unto the LORD as long as I live; I will sing praise to my God while I have my being.
104.34: My meditation of him shall be sweet; I will be glad in the LORD.
104.35: Let the sinners be consumed out of the earth, and let the wicked be no more. Bless thou the LORD, O my soul. Halelu- JAH (Praise ye the LORD).

105.1: O give thanks unto the LORD; call upon his name; make known his deeds among the peoples.
105.2: Sing unto him, sing psalms unto him; speak of all his wondrous works.
105.3: Glory in his holy name; let the heart of those that seek the LORD rejoice.
105.4: Seek the LORD and his strength; seek his face continually.
105.5: Remember his marvellous works that he has done, his wonders and the judgments of his mouth,
105.6: O ye seed of Abraham his slave, ye sons of Jacob his chosen.
105.7: He is the LORD our God; his judgments are in all the earth.
105.8: He has remembered his covenant for ever, the word which he commanded for a thousand generations,
105.9: which covenant he made with Abraham and his oath unto Isaac
105.10: and confirmed the same unto Jacob by decree, and to Israel for an everlasting covenant:
105.11: Saying, Unto thee will I give the land of Canaan, the lot of your inheritance,
105.12: when they were but a few men in number; yea, very few, and strangers in it.
105.13: When they went from nation to nation from one kingdom to another people,
105.14: he suffered no man to do them wrong; yea, he chastened kings for their sakes:
105.15: Saying, Touch not mine anointed and do my prophets no harm.
105.16: Moreover he called for a famine upon the land; he broke the whole staff of bread.
105.17: He sent a man before them, even Joseph, who was sold for a slave,
105.18: whose feet they hurt with fetters; his soul was laid in iron.
105.19: Until the time that his word came, the spoken word of the LORD purified him.
105.20: The king sent and loosed him, the ruler of the people let him go free.
105.21: He made him lord of his house and ruler of all his substance:
105.22: To bind his princes at his pleasure and teach his elders wisdom.
105.23: Afterwards Israel entered into Egypt, and Jacob was a stranger in the land of Ham.
105.24: And he increased his people greatly and made them stronger than their enemies.
105.25: He turned their heart to hate his people to think evil against his slaves.
105.26: He sent Moses his slave and Aaron whom he had chosen.
105.27: He put the words of his signs in them and his wonders in the land of Ham.
105.28: He sent darkness and made it dark, and they did not rebel against his word.
105.29: He turned their waters into blood and slew their fish.
105.30: Their land brought forth frogs in abundance in the chambers of their kings.
105.31: He spoke, and swarms of flies and lice came within all their borders.
105.32: He turned their rain into hail, into flaming fire in their land.
105.33: He smote their vines also and their fig trees and broke the trees within their borders.
105.34: He spoke, and the locusts came and caterpillars without number,
105.35: and ate up all the grass in their land and devoured the fruit of their ground.
105.36: He smote also all the firstborn in their land, the chief of all their strength.
105.37: And he brought them forth with silver and gold, and there was not one sick person among their tribes.
105.38: Egypt was glad when they departed, for the fear of them fell upon them.
105.39: He spread a cloud for a covering and fire to give light in the night.
105.40: The people asked, and he brought quails and satisfied them with the bread of heaven.
105.41: He opened the rock, and the waters gushed out; they ran in the dry places and became a river.
105.42: For he remembered his holy word with Abraham his slave.
105.43: And he brought forth his people with joy and his chosen with singing
105.44: and gave them the lands of the Gentiles, and they inherited the labour of the nations,
105.45: that they might observe his statutes and keep his laws. Halelu-JAH.

106.1: Halelu-JAH. O give thanks unto the LORD, for he is good, for his mercy endures for ever.
106.2: Who can utter the mighty acts of the LORD? Who can show forth all his praise?
106.3: Happy are those that keep judgment and he that does righteousness at all times.
106.4: Remember me, O LORD, with the favour that thou dost bear unto thy people; O visit me with thy saving health,
106.5: that I may see the good of thy chosen, that I may rejoice in the gladness of thy nation, that I may glory with thine inheritance.
106.6: We have sinned with our fathers, we have committed iniquity; we have done wickedly.
106.7: Our fathers did not understand thy wonders in Egypt; they did not remember the multitude of thy mercies but rebelled by the sea, even at the Red Sea.
106.8: Nevertheless he saved them for his name’s sake, that he might make his mighty power to be known.
106.9: He reprehended the Red Sea also, and it was dried up, so he led them through the depths, as through the wilderness.
106.10: And he saved them from the hand of him that hated them and redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.
106.11: And the waters covered their enemies: there was not one of them left.
106.12: Then they believed his words; they sang his praise.
106.13: They became rash. They soon forgot his works; they waited not for his counsel:
106.14: They gave themselves over to lust in the wilderness and tempted God in the desert.
106.15: And he gave them their request, but sent leanness into their soul.
106.16: Then they envied Moses in the camp and Aaron the saint of the LORD.
106.17: The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan and covered the company of Abiram.
106.18: And a fire was kindled in their company; the flame burned up the wicked.
106.19: They made a calf in Horeb and worshipped the molten image.
106.20: Thus they changed their glory into the similitude of an ox that eats grass.
106.21: They forgot the God of their saving health, who had done great things in Egypt,
106.22: wondrous works in the land of Ham, and terrible things upon the Red Sea.
106.23: Therefore he said that he would destroy them, had not Moses his chosen stood before him in the breach, to turn away his wrath lest he should destroy them.
106.24: And they despised the pleasant land; they did not believe his word:
106.25: But murmured in their tents and did not hearken unto the voice of the LORD.
106.26: Therefore he lifted up his hand against them, to overthrow them in the wilderness,
106.27: to overthrow their seed also among the Gentiles, and to scatter them in the lands.
106.28: They also joined themselves unto Baalpeor and ate the sacrifices for the dead.
106.29: Thus they provoked him to anger with their inventions; and the plague broke in upon them.
106.30: Then Phinehas stood up and executed judgment, and so the plague was stayed.
106.31: And that was counted unto him for righteousness from generation to generation for evermore.
106.32: They angered him also at the waters of strife, so that it went ill with Moses for their sakes:
106.33: Because they provoked his spirit to rebel, and he spoke it with his lips.
106.34: They did not destroy the nations, concerning whom the LORD commanded them:
106.35: But were mingled among the Gentiles and learned their works.
106.36: And they served their idols, which were a snare unto them.
106.37: Yea, they sacrificed their sons and their daughters unto devils
106.38: and shed innocent blood, even the blood of their sons and of their daughters, whom they sacrificed unto the idols of Canaan; and the land was polluted with blood.
106.39: Thus they were defiled with their own works and went a whoring with their own inventions.
106.40: Therefore was the wrath of the LORD kindled against his people, insomuch that he abhorred his own inheritance.
106.41: And he gave them into the hand of the Gentiles, and those that hated them ruled over them.
106.42: Their enemies oppressed them, and they were brought into subjection under their hand.
106.43: He delivered them many times, but they rebelled at his counsel and were brought low for their iniquity.
106.44: Nevertheless he would look upon their affliction and hear their cry
106.45: and remember his covenant with them and repent according to the multitude of his mercies.
106.46: He also caused those that carried them captives to have mercy upon them.
106.47: Save us, O LORD our God, and gather us from among the Gentiles, that we might lift up thy holy name, that we might glory in thy praise.
106.48: Blessed be the LORD God of Israel from everlasting to everlasting; and let all the people say, Amen. Halelu-JAH.

107.1: O give thanks unto the LORD, for he is good; for his mercy endures for ever.
107.2: Let the redeemed of the LORD say so, whom he has redeemed from the hand of the enemy
107.3: and gathered them out of the lands, from the east and from the west, from the north and from the south.
107.4: They wandered lost in the wilderness, alone and out of the way; they found no city to dwell in.
107.5: Hungry and thirsty, their soul fainted in them.
107.6: Then they cried unto the LORD in their trouble, and he delivered them out of their distresses.
107.7: And he led them forth by the right way, that they might go to a city of habitation.
107.8: Oh that men would praise the LORD for his mercy and for his wonderful works unto the sons of Adam!
107.9: For he satisfies the soul that is destitute and fills the hungry soul with goodness.
107.10: Such as sat in darkness and in the shadow of death, being bound in affliction and in irons,
107.11: because they rebelled against the words of God and condemned the counsel of the most High:
107.12: Therefore he brought down their heart with labour; they fell down, and there was no one to help.
107.13: Then they cried unto the LORD in their trouble, and he saved them out of their distresses.
107.14: He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death and broke their bonds asunder.
107.15: Oh that men would praise the LORD for his mercy and for his wonderful works unto the sons of Adam!
107.16: For he has broken the gates of brass and cut the bars of iron asunder.
107.17: The fools, because of the way of their rebellion, and because of their iniquities, were afflicted.
107.18: Their soul abhorred all manner of food, and they drew near unto the gates of death.
107.19: Then they cried unto the LORD in their trouble, and he saved them out of their distresses.
107.20: He sent his word and healed them and delivered them from their graves.
107.21: Oh that men would praise the LORD for his mercy and for his wonderful works unto the sons of Adam!
107.22: And let them offer the sacrifices of praise and publish his works with singing.
107.23: Those that go down to the sea in ships that do work in many waters,
107.24: these have seen the works of the LORD and his wonders in the deep.
107.25: For he commands and raises the stormy wind, which lifts up its waves.
107.26: They mount up to the heavens; they go down again to the depths; their soul is melted because of trouble.
107.27: They reel to and fro and stagger like a drunken man, and all of their knowledge is of no avail.
107.28: Then they cry unto the LORD in their trouble, and he delivers them out of their afflictions.
107.29: He makes the storm a calm, so that its waves are still.
107.30: Then they are glad because they are at rest; so he brings them into the haven of his will.
107.31: Oh that men would praise the LORD for his mercy and for his wonderful works unto the sons of Adam!
107.32: Let them exalt him also in the congregation of the people and praise him in the assembly of the elders.
107.33: He turned rivers into a wilderness and the watersprings into dry ground;
107.34: the fruitful land into salt flats, because of the wickedness of those that dwell therein.
107.35: He turns the wilderness into reservoirs of water and dry ground into watersprings.
107.36: And there he makes the hungry to dwell, that they may prepare a city for habitation
107.37: and sow the fields and plant vineyards, which may yield fruits of increase.
107.38: He blesses them also, so that they are multiplied greatly and suffers not their cattle to decrease.
107.39: Again, they are diminished and brought low through oppression, affliction, and sorrow.
107.40: He pours contempt upon princes and causes them to wander in the wilderness, where there is no way.
107.41: Yet he sets the poor on high from affliction and makes his families like a flock.
107.42: The righteous shall see it and rejoice, and all iniquity shall stop her mouth.
107.43: Who is wise and will observe these things and shall understand the mercies of the LORD?

108.1: O God, my heart is fixed; I will sing and give praise; this is my glory.
108.2: Awake, psaltery and harp; I will awake the dawn.
108.3: I will praise thee, O LORD, among the peoples, and I will sing praises unto thee among the nations.
108.4: For thy mercy is great above the heavens, and thy truth reaches unto the heavens.
108.5: Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens and thy glory above all the earth;
108.6: that thy beloved may be delivered: save with thy right hand, and answer me.
108.7: God has spoken in his holiness; I will rejoice, I will divide Shechem and mete out the valley of Succoth.
108.8: Gilead shall be mine; Manasseh shall be mine; Ephraim also shall be the strength of my head; Judah shall be my lawgiver;
108.9: Moab shall be my washpot; over Edom I will cast my shoe; over Philistia I will triumph.
108.10: Who will bring me into the strong city? who will lead me into Edom?
108.11: Surely thou, O God, who had cast us off and did not, O God, go forth with our hosts.
108.12: Give us help from trouble; for the salvation of man is deception.
108.13: Through God we shall do valiantly, for he shall tread down our enemies again.

109.1: Do not hold thy peace, O God of my praise;
109.2: for the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of the deceitful are opened against me; they have spoken of me with a lying tongue.
109.3: They compassed me about with words of hatred and fought against me without a cause.
109.4: They have responded to my love by becoming my adversaries, but I give myself unto prayer.
109.5: And they have rewarded me evil for good, and hatred for my love.
109.6: Set thou the wicked man over him, and let Satan stand at his right hand.
109.7: When he shall be judged, let him be condemned, and let his prayer become sin.
109.8: Let his days be few, and let another take his office.
109.9: Let his children be fatherless and his wife a widow.
109.10: Let his children be continually vagabonds and beg; let them seek their bread out of their desolate places.
109.11: Let the extortioner catch all that he has, and let the strangers spoil his labour.
109.12: Let there be no one to extend mercy unto him: neither let there be any to favour his fatherless children.
109.13: Let his posterity be cut off, and in the generation following let their name be blotted out.
109.14: Let the iniquity of his fathers be remembered with the LORD, and let not the sin of his mother be blotted out.
109.15: Let them be before the LORD continually, that he may cut off the memory of them from the earth.
109.16: Because he did not remember to show mercy but persecuted the man who is poor in spirit and destitute and broken in heart, that he might slay him.
109.17: As he loved the curse, so let it come unto him; as he delighted not in the blessing, so let it be far from him.
109.18: As he clothed himself with the curse like as with his garment, and it entered into his bowels like water and like oil into his bones.
109.19: Let it be unto him as the garment which covers him and for a girdle wherewith he is girded continually.
109.20: Let this be the reward from the LORD of those who spoke falsely against me and of those that speak evil against my soul.
109.21: And thou, O GOD the Lord, do unto me for thy name’s sake; because thy mercy is good, deliver me.
109.22: For I am poor and needy, and my heart is wounded within me.
109.23: I am gone like the shadow when it declines; I am tossed up and down by the wind as the locust.
109.24: My knees are weak through fasting, and my flesh fails for lack of fatness.
109.25: I have become a reproach unto them; when they looked upon me they shook their heads.
109.26: Help me, O LORD my God; O save me according to thy mercy,
109.27: that they may know that this is thy hand, that thou, O LORD, hast done it.
109.28: Let them curse, but bless thou; when they arise, let them be ashamed, but let thy slave rejoice.
109.29: Let those who speak evil against me falsely be clothed with shame, and let them cover themselves with their own confusion as with a mantle.
109.30: I will greatly praise the LORD with my mouth; yea, I will praise him among the multitude.
109.31: For he shall stand at the right hand of the poor in spirit to save his soul from those that judge him.

110.1: The LORD said unto my Lord, Sit thou at my right hand until I make thine enemies thy footstool.
110.2: The LORD shall send the rod of thy strength out of Zion; rule thou in the midst of thine enemies.
110.3: Thy people shall be willing in the day of thy power, in the beauty of holiness; as the dew which falls from the womb of the morning, thus shall those who are thine be born unto thee.
110.4: The LORD has sworn and will not repent, Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchizedek.
110.5: The Lord at thy right hand shall smite the kings in the day of his wrath.
110.6: He shall judge among the Gentiles; he shall fill their places with dead bodies; he shall wound the head over much of the earth.
110.7: He shall drink of the brook in the way; therefore he shall lift up his head.

111.1: Halelu-JAH. I will praise the LORD with my whole heart, Beth in the company and in the congregation of the upright.
111.2: The works of the LORD are great, Daleth sought out by all those that have pleasure therein.
111.3: Honor and beauty are his work; Vau and his righteousness endures for ever.
111.4:
He has made his wonderful works to be remembered;
The LORD is gracious and merciful.
111.5: He has given sustenance unto those that fear him; Jod He will ever be mindful of his covenant.
111.6:
He has shown his people the power of his works,
by giving them the inheritance of the Gentiles.
111.7:
The works of his hands are truth and judgment;
all his commandments are sure.
111.8:
They stand fast from age to age
and are made in truth and uprightness.

112.1:
Halelu-JAH. Blessed is the man that fears the LORD,
that delights greatly in his commandments.
112.2:
His seed shall be mighty upon earth;
the generation of the upright shall be blessed.
112.3:
Wealth and riches shall be in his house;
and his righteousness endures for ever.
112.4:
A light has shined in the darkness upon the upright:
Gracious and merciful and righteous.
112.5:
A good man has mercy and lends;
He will govern his affairs with good judgment.
112.6:
Surely he shall not be moved for ever;
the righteous shall be in eternal remembrance.
112.7:
He shall not be afraid of evil rumours;
his heart is fixed, trusting in the LORD.
112.8:
His heart is established; he shall not be afraid,
until he sees his desire upon his enemies.

113.1: Halelu-JAH. Praise, O ye slaves of the LORD, praise the name of the LORD.
113.2: Blessed be the name of the LORD from this time forth and for evermore.
113.3: From the rising of the sun unto the going down of the same, the LORD’s name is to be praised.
113.4: The LORD is high above all Gentiles and his glory above the heavens.
113.5: Who is like unto the LORD our God, who dwells on high,
113.6: who humbles himself to behold the things that are in heaven and in the earth!
113.7: He raises up the poor out of the dust and lifts the destitute out of the dunghill;
113.8: that he may set him with princes, even with the princes of his people.
113.9: He makes the barren woman to keep house and to be a joyful mother of sons. Halelu-JAH.

114.1: When Israel went out of Egypt, the house of Jacob from a people of strange language,
114.2: Judah was his holiness, and Israel his dominion.
114.3: The sea saw it and fled; Jordan was driven back.
114.4: The mountains skipped like rams and the little hills like lambs.
114.5: What came upon thee, O thou sea, that thou didst flee? And thou O Jordan, that thou wast driven back?
114.6: Ye mountains, why didst ye skip like rams and ye little hills, like lambs?
114.7: At the presence of the Lord, the earth trembles, at the presence of the God of Jacob,
114.8: who turned the rock into a reservoir of water, the flint into a fountain of waters.

115.1: Not unto us, O LORD, not unto us, but unto thy name give glory, for thy mercy and for thy truth.
115.2: Why should the Gentiles say, Where is now their God?
115.3: But our God is in the heavens; he has made whatever he has desired.
115.4: Their idols are silver and gold, the work of men’s hands.
115.5: They have mouths, but they shall never speak; they have eyes, but they shall never see:
115.6: They have ears, but they shall never hear; they have noses, but they shall never smell;
115.7: they have hands, but they shall never touch; they have feet, but they shall never walk; they shall never speak through their throat.
115.8: Let those that make them become like unto them, and every one that trusts in them.
115.9: O Israel, trust thou in the LORD; he is your help and your shield.
115.10: O house of Aaron, trust in the LORD; he is your help and your shield.
115.11: Ye that fear the LORD, trust in the LORD; he is your help and your shield.
115.12: The LORD has been mindful of us: he will bless us; he will greatly bless the house of Israel; he will bless the house of Aaron.
115.13: He will bless those that fear the LORD, both small and great.
115.14: The LORD shall increase his blessing upon you more and more, upon you and your sons.
115.15: Ye are blessed of the LORD who made the heavens and earth.
115.16: The heavens are the heavens of the LORD, but the earth he has given to the sons of Adam.
115.17: The dead shall not praise JAH, neither any that go down into silence.
115.18: But we will bless JAH from this time forth and for evermore. Halelu-JAH.

116.1: I love the LORD, because he has heard my voice and my supplications.
116.2: Because he has inclined his ear unto me, therefore I will call upon him all of my days.
116.3: The sorrows of death compassed me and the pains of Sheol found me; I encountered trouble and sorrow.
116.4: Then I called upon the name of the LORD, saying, O LORD, I beseech thee, deliver my soul.
116.5: Gracious is the LORD, and righteous; yea, our God is merciful.
116.6: The LORD preserves the simple; I was brought low, and he saved me.
116.7: Return unto thy rest, O my soul, for the LORD has dealt bountifully with thee.
116.8: For thou hast delivered my soul from death, mine eyes from tears, and my feet from falling.
116.9: I will walk before the LORD in the land of the living.
116.10: I believed, therefore I spoke, and was greatly afflicted;
116.11: I said in my haste, All men are liars.
116.12: What shall I render unto the LORD for all his benefits toward me?
116.13: I will take the cup of saving health and invoke the name of the LORD.
116.14: I will pay my vows unto the LORD now in the presence of all his people.
116.15: Precious in the sight of the LORD is the death of his merciful ones.
116.16: This is so, O LORD, because I am thy slave; I am thy slave, the son of thine handmaid; thou hast loosed my bonds.
116.17: I will offer unto thee the sacrifice of praise and will invoke the name of the LORD.
116.18: I will pay my vows unto the LORD now in the presence of all his people,
116.19: in the courts of the LORD’s house, in the midst of thee, O Jerusalem. Halelu-JAH.

117.1: O praise the LORD, all ye Gentiles; praise him, all ye peoples.
117.2: For he has greatly increased his mercy upon us; and the truth of the LORD endures for ever. Halelu-JAH.

118.1: O give thanks unto the LORD; for he is good because his mercy endures for ever.
118.2: Let Israel now say that his mercy endures for ever.
118.3: Let the house of Aaron now say, that his mercy endures for ever.
118.4: Let those that fear the LORD say now, that his mercy is eternal.
118.5: From a tight place I called upon JAH; and JAH answered me and set me in a wide place.
118.6: The LORD is for me; I will not fear what man can do unto me.
118.7: The LORD takes my part with those that help me; therefore I shall see my desire upon those that hate me.
118.8: It is better to wait upon the LORD than to wait upon man.
118.9: It is better to trust in the LORD than to put confidence in princes.
118.10: All the nations compassed me about; but in the name of the LORD I will cut them off.
118.11: They compassed me about; yea, they laid hold of me; but in the name of the LORD I will cut them off.
118.12: They compassed me about like bees; they were quenched as the fire of thorns; for in the name of the LORD I will cut them off.
118.13: Thou hast thrust at me with violence that I might fall, but the LORD helped me.
118.14: JAH is my strength and song and is become my saving health.
118.15: The voice of singing and saving health is in the tents of the righteous; the right hand of the LORD does valiantly.
118.16: The right hand of the LORD is exalted; the right hand of the LORD does valiantly.
118.17: I shall not die, but live and declare the works of JAH.
118.18: JAH has chastened me sore, but he has not given me over unto death.
118.19: Open unto me the gates of righteousness; I will go in through them; I will praise JAH.
118.20: This gate is of the LORD; the righteous shall enter in.
118.21: I will praise thee; for thou hast heard me and art become my saving health.
118.22: The stone which the builders rejected is become the head of the corner.
118.23: This is the LORD’s doing; it is marvellous in our eyes.
118.24: This is the day which the LORD has made; we will rejoice and be glad in it.
118.25: Save now, I beseech thee, O LORD; O LORD, I beseech thee, cause us now to prosper.
118.26: Blessed be he that comes in the name of the LORD; from the house of the LORD we bless you.
118.27: God is the LORD, who has shined on us; bind the sacrifice with cords, even unto the horns of the altar.
118.28: Thou art my God, and I will praise thee; thou art my God, I will exalt thee.
118.29: O give thanks unto the LORD; for he is good, for his mercy endures for ever.

119.1: Blessed are those who walk in the perfect way, who walk in the law of the LORD.
119.2: Blessed are those that keep his testimonies and that seek him with their whole heart.
119.3: For those who do no iniquity walk in his ways.
119.4: Thou hast commanded us to keep thy precepts diligently.
119.5: O that my ways were ordered to keep thy statutes!
119.6: Then I shall not be ashamed, when I have insight unto all thy commandments.
119.7: I will praise thee with uprightness of heart when I shall have learned thy righteous judgments.
119.8: I will keep thy statutes; O do not utterly forsake me.
119.9: With what shall a young man cleanse his way? when he shall keep thy word.
119.10: With my whole heart I have sought thee; O let me not err from thy commandments.
119.11: Thy spoken word have I hid in my heart that I might not sin against thee.
119.12: Blessed art thou, O LORD: teach me thy statutes.
119.13: With my lips I have declared all the judgments of thy mouth.
119.14: I have rejoiced in the way of thy testimonies as above all riches.
119.15: I will meditate in thy precepts and consider thy ways.
119.16: I will delight myself in thy statutes; I will not forget thy words.
119.17: Deal bountifully with thy slave that I may live and keep thy word.
119.18: Open my eyes, and I shall behold the wonders of thy law.
119.19: I am a stranger in the earth; hide not thy commandments from me.
119.20: My soul is broken from desiring thy judgments at all times.
119.21: Thou hast reprehended the proud; cursed are those who err from thy commandments.
119.22: Remove from me reproach and contempt, for I have kept thy testimonies.
119.23: Princes also sat and spoke against me as thy slave spoke according to thy statutes.
119.24: For thy testimonies are my delight and my counsellors.
119.25: My soul cleaves unto the dust; quicken me according to thy word.
119.26: I have declared my ways, and thou didst hear me; teach me thy statutes.
119.27: Make me to understand the way of thy precepts; so I shall meditate of thy wondrous works.
119.28: My soul melts for heaviness; strengthen me according to thy word.
119.29: Remove from me the way of lying, and from thy law grant me mercy.
119.30: I have chosen the way of truth; I have laid thy judgments before me.
119.31: I have stuck unto thy testimonies; O LORD, put me not to shame.
119.32: I will run the way of thy commandments when thou shalt enlarge my heart.
119.33: Teach me, O LORD, the way of thy statutes, and I shall keep it unto the end.
119.34: Give me understanding, and I shall keep thy law; yea, I shall observe it with my whole heart.
119.35: Make me to go in the path of thy commandments, for therein do I delight.
119.36: Incline my heart unto thy testimonies and not to covetousness.
119.37: Turn away my eyes from beholding vanity, and cause me to live in thy way.
119.38: Confirm thy word unto thy slave, who is devoted to thy fear.
119.39: Turn away my reproach which I have feared, for thy judgments are good.
119.40: Behold, I have longed after thy precepts; cause me to live in thy righteousness.
119.41: Let thy mercy come unto me, O LORD, even thy salvation, according to thy spoken word.
119.42: And I shall answer him that reproaches me, by saying that I trust in thy word.
119.43: And take not at any time the word of truth out of my mouth; for I wait for thy judgment.
119.44: So shall I keep thy law continually from age to age.
119.45: And I will walk at liberty, for I sought thy commandments.
119.46: I will speak of thy testimonies also before kings and will not be ashamed.
119.47: And I will delight myself in thy commandments, which I have loved.
119.48: I will lift up My hands unto thy commandments, which I have loved, and I will meditate in thy statutes.
119.49: Remember the word unto thy slave, in which thou hast caused me to wait.
119.50: This is my comfort in my affliction; for thy spoken word has caused me to live.
119.51: The proud have had me greatly in derision; yet I have not deviated from thy law.
119.52: I remembered thy judgments of old, O LORD, and have consoled myself.
119.53: Horror has taken hold upon me because of the wicked that forsake thy law.
119.54: Thy statutes have been my songs in the house of my pilgrimage.
119.55: I have remembered thy name, O LORD, in the night, and have kept thy law.
119.56: This I had, because I kept thy precepts.
119.57: My portion, O LORD, I have said, will be to keep thy words.
119.58: I intreated thy presence with my whole heart; be merciful unto me according to thy word.
119.59: I considered my ways and turned my feet unto thy testimonies.
119.60: I made haste and did not delay to keep thy commandments.
119.61: The company of the wicked have robbed me, but I have not forgotten thy law.
119.62: At midnight I will rise to give thanks unto thee because of the judgments of thy righteousness.
119.63: I am a companion of all those that fear thee and of those that keep thy precepts.
119.64: The earth, O LORD, is full of thy mercy and teaches me thy statutes.
119.65: Thou hast dealt well with thy slave, O LORD, according unto thy word,
119.66: which teaches me discernment and knowledge, for I have believed thy commandments.
119.67: Before I was humbled, I went into error, but now I keep thy spoken word.
119.68: Thou art good and doest good; teach me thy statutes.
119.69: The proud have forged a lie against me, but I will keep thy precepts with my whole heart.
119.70: Their heart became fat like grease, but I delight in thy law.
119.71: It was good for me that I have been humbled, that I might learn thy statutes.
119.72: The law of thy mouth is better unto me than thousands of gold and silver.
119.73: Thy hands have made me and fashioned me; give me understanding, and I shall learn thy commandments.
119.74: Those that fear thee will be glad when they see me because I have waited on thy word.
119.75: I know, O LORD, that thy judgments are right and that thou in faithfulness hast afflicted me.
119.76: Let, I pray thee, thy mercy be for my comfort, according to thy spoken word unto thy slave.
119.77: Let thy mercy come unto me, that I may live, for thy law is my delight.
119.78: Let the proud be ashamed, for they dealt perversely with me without a cause, but I will meditate in thy precepts.
119.79: Let those that fear thee turn unto me and those that have known thy testimonies.
119.80: Let my heart be perfect in thy statutes that I not be ashamed.
119.81: My soul faints with desire for thy salvation as I await thy word.
119.82: Mine eyes fail for thy spoken word, saying, When wilt thou comfort me?
119.83: For I am become like a wine skin in the smoke; yet I have not forgotten thy statutes.
119.84: How many are the days of thy slave? When wilt thou execute judgment on those that persecute me?
119.85: The proud have dug pits for me, but they do not proceed according to thy law.
119.86: All thy commandments are of the same truth; they persecute me wrongfully; help me.
119.87: They have almost consumed me upon earth, but I have not forsaken thy precepts.
119.88: Cause me to live according to thy mercy, so I shall keep the testimony of thy mouth.
119.89: For ever, O LORD, thy word is settled in the heavens.
119.90: Thy truth is from generation to generation; thou hast established the earth, and it perseveres.
119.91: They persevere unto this day by thy ordinance; for they are all thy slaves.
119.92: Unless thy law had been my delight, I should have perished in my affliction.
119.93: I will never forget thy precepts; for with them thou hast caused me to live.
119.94: I am thine, keep me; for I have sought thy precepts.
119.95: The wicked have waited for me to destroy me, but I will consider thy testimonies.
119.96: I have seen an end of all perfection, but thy commandment is exceeding broad.
119.97: O how I love thy law! it is my meditation all the day.
119.98: Thou through thy commandments hast made me wiser than mine enemies, for they are eternal unto me.
119.99: I have more understanding than all my teachers, for thy testimonies have been my meditation.
119.100: I understand more than the elders because I keep thy precepts.
119.101: I have refrained my feet from every evil way, that I might keep thy word.
119.102: I have not departed from thy judgments, for thou hast taught me.
119.103: How sweet have been thy spoken words unto my taste! yea, sweeter than honey to my mouth!
119.104: Through thy precepts I have obtained understanding; therefore I have hated every false way.
119.105: Thy word is a lamp unto my feet and a light unto my way.
119.106: I have sworn, and I will perform it, that I will keep the judgments of thy righteousness.
119.107: I am afflicted very much; cause me to live, O LORD, according to thy word.
119.108: Accept, I beseech thee, the freewill offerings of my mouth, O LORD, and teach me thy judgments.
119.109: My soul is continually in my hand; yet I do not forget thy law.
119.110: The wicked have laid a snare for me; yet did not I err from thy precepts.
119.111: I have taken thy testimonies as a heritage for ever; for they are the rejoicing of my heart.
119.112: I have inclined my heart to perform thy statutes always, even unto the end.
119.113: I hate vain thoughts; but I love thy law.
119.114: Thou art my hiding place and my shield; I have waited for thy word.
119.115: Depart from me, ye evildoers; for I will keep the commandments of my God.
119.116: Uphold me according unto thy word, and I shall live; and let me not be ashamed of my hope.
119.117: Hold me up, and I shall be saved, and I shall delight in thy statutes continually.
119.118: Thou hast trodden down all those that err from thy statutes; for their deceit is falsehood.
119.119: Thou dost cause all the wicked of the earth to come undone like dross; therefore I have loved thy testimonies.
119.120: My flesh trembles for fear of thee, and I am afraid of thy judgments.
119.121: I have complied with judgment and righteousness; do not leave me to my oppressors.
119.122: Be surety for thy slave for good; do not let the proud do violence unto me.
119.123: Mine eyes fail for thy saving health and for the spoken word of thy righteousness.
119.124: Deal with thy slave according to thy mercy, and teach me thy statutes.
119.125: I am thy slave; give me understanding, that I may know thy testimonies.
119.126: It is time for thee, O LORD, to act; for they have dissipated thy law.
119.127: Therefore I have loved thy commandments above gold, yea, above fine gold.
119.128: Therefore I have esteemed all thy precepts concerning all things to be right and I have hated every false way.
119.129: Thy testimonies are wonderful; therefore does my soul keep them.
119.130: The exposition of thy words gives light; it gives understanding unto the simple.
119.131: I opened my mouth and panted; for I longed for thy commandments.
119.132: Look thou upon me and be merciful unto me, as thou didst use to do unto those that love thy name.
119.133: Order my steps with thy word; and let not any iniquity have dominion over me.
119.134: Ransom me from the violence of men, and I will keep thy precepts.
119.135: Make thy face to shine upon thy slave and teach me thy statutes.
119.136: Rivers of waters ran down my eyes because they did not keep thy law.
119.137: Righteous art thou, O LORD, and upright are thy judgments.
119.138: Thou hast commanded righteousness, which consists of thy testimonies and thy truth.
119.139: My zeal has consumed me, because my enemies have forgotten thy words.
119.140: Thy word is very pure; therefore thy slave loves it.
119.141: I am small and despised; yet I have not forgotten thy precepts.
119.142: Thy righteousness is eternal righteousness, and thy law is the truth.
119.143: Trouble and anguish found me; but thy commandments were my delights.
119.144: Thy testimonies are eternal righteousness; give me understanding, and I shall live.
119.145: I cried with my whole heart; answer me, O LORD, and I will keep thy statutes.
119.146: I cried unto thee; save me, and I shall keep thy testimonies.
119.147: I arose before the dawning of the morning and cried: I waited in thy word.
119.148: My eyes anticipate the night watches that I might meditate in thy spoken word.
119.149: Hear my voice according to thy mercy; O LORD, cause me to live according to thy judgment.
119.150: Those that persecute me draw near unto evil; they have strayed from thy law.
119.151: Thou art near, O LORD; and all thy commandments are truth.
119.152: Concerning thy testimonies, I have known of old that thou hast founded them for ever.
119.153: Consider my affliction and deliver me; for I have not forgotten thy law.
119.154: Plead my cause and redeem me; quicken me according to thy spoken word.
119.155: Saving health is far from the wicked, for they do not seek thy statutes.
119.156: Many are thy tender mercies, O LORD: cause me to live according to thy judgments.
119.157: Many are my persecutors and my enemies; yet I do not deviate from thy testimonies.
119.158: I beheld the transgressors and was grieved because they did not keep thy words.
119.159: Consider, O LORD, that I love thy precepts; cause me to live according to thy mercy.
119.160: The beginning of thy word is truth, and every one of the judgments of thy righteousness is eternal.
119.161: Princes have persecuted me without a cause, but my heart stands in awe of thy words.
119.162: I rejoice at thy spoken word, as one that finds great spoil.
119.163: I hate and abhor lying, but I love thy law.
119.164: Seven times a day do I praise thee because of the judgments of thy righteousness.
119.165: Those who love thy law have great peace, and nothing shall cause them to stumble.
119.166: LORD, I have waited for thy saving health and done thy commandments.
119.167: My soul has kept thy testimonies, and I have loved them exceedingly.
119.168: I have kept thy precepts and thy testimonies, for all my ways are before thee.
119.169: Let my cry come near before thee, O LORD; give me understanding according to thy word.
119.170: Let my supplication come before thee; deliver me according to thy spoken word.
119.171: My lips shall overflow with praise when thou hast taught me thy statutes.
119.172: My tongue shall speak thy words; for all thy commandments are righteousness.
119.173: Let thine hand help me, for I have chosen thy precepts.
119.174: I have longed for thy saving health, O LORD, and thy law is my delight.
119.175: Let my soul live, and it shall praise thee, and let thy judgments help me.
119.176: I have gone astray like a lost sheep; seek thy slave; for I have not forgotten thy commandments.

120.1: In my distress I cried unto the LORD, and he answered me.
120.2: Deliver my soul, O LORD, from lying lips and from a deceitful tongue.
120.3: What shall be given unto thee? or what shall be done unto thee, thou false tongue?
120.4: Sharp arrows of the mighty, with coals of juniper.
120.5: Woe is me, that I sojourn in Mesech, that I dwell in the tents of Kedar!
120.6: My soul has long dwelt with those that hate peace.
120.7: I am for peace; but when I speak, they are for war.

121.1: I will lift up mine eyes unto the mountains, from whence cometh my help.
121.2: My help comes from the LORD, who made the heavens and earth.
121.3: He will not suffer thy foot to be moved; he that keeps thee will not slumber.
121.4: Behold, he that keeps Israel shall neither slumber nor sleep.
121.5: The LORD is thy keeper: the LORD is thy shade upon thy right hand.
121.6: The sun shall not smite thee by day, nor the moon by night.
121.7: The LORD shall preserve thee from all evil; he shall preserve thy soul.
121.8: The LORD shall preserve thy going out and thy coming in from this time forth, and even for evermore.

122.1: I was glad when they said unto me, Let us go into the house of the LORD.
122.2: Our feet stood within thy gates, O Jerusalem.
122.3: Jerusalem, that one which is built as a city that is well united together
122.4: Because the tribes went up there, the tribes of JAH, the testimony to Israel, to praise the name of the LORD.
122.5: For there are set thrones of the judgment, the thrones of the house of David.
122.6: Pray for the peace of Jerusalem; those that love thee shall be brought into rest.
122.7: Peace be within thy walls and rest within thy palaces.
122.8: For my brethren and companions’ sakes, I will now say, Peace be within thee.
122.9: Because of the house of the LORD our God, I will seek thy good.

123.1: Unto thee I lift up mine eyes, O thou that dwellest in the heavens.
123.2: Behold, as the eyes of slaves look unto the hand of their masters and as the eyes of a maiden unto the hand of her mistress, so our eyes wait upon the LORD our God, until he shall have mercy upon us.
123.3: Have mercy upon us, O LORD, have mercy upon us, for we are exceedingly weary of being held in contempt.
123.4: Our soul is exceedingly weary of the scorning of those that are at ease and of the contempt of the proud.

124.1: If the LORD had not been for us, now may Israel say,
124.2: If the LORD had not been for us, when men rose up against us,
124.3: then they would have swallowed us up alive, when their wrath was kindled against us;
124.4: then the waters would have overwhelmed us; the flood would have gone over our soul;
124.5: then the proud waters would have gone over our soul.
124.6: Blessed be the LORD, who did not give us as a prey to their teeth.
124.7: Our soul has escaped as a bird out of the snare of the fowlers; the snare has broken, and we are escaped.
124.8: Our help is in the name of the LORD, who made the heaven and the earth.

125.1: Those that trust in the LORD are as Mount Zion, which cannot be removed but abides for ever.
125.2: As the mountains are round about Jerusalem, so the LORD is round about his people from now on even for ever.
125.3: For the rod of wickedness shall not rest upon the lot of the righteous because the righteous shall not put forth their hands unto iniquity.
125.4: Do good, O LORD, unto those that are good and to those that are upright in their hearts.
125.5: As for such as turn aside unto their crooked ways, the LORD shall take them away with the workers of iniquity; and peace shall be upon Israel.

126.1: When the LORD shall turn again the captivity of Zion, we shall be like those that dream.
126.2: Then our mouth shall be filled with laughter and our tongue with singing; then they shall say among the Gentiles, The LORD has done great things with them.
126.3: The LORD has done great things with us, of which we shall be glad.
126.4: Turn again our captivity, O LORD, as the streams in the south.
126.5: Those that sow with tears shall reap with joy.
126.6: He that goes forth and weeps, bearing the precious seed, shall doubtless come again with rejoicing, bringing his sheaves with him.

127.1: Unless the LORD builds the house, they labour in vain that build it; unless the LORD keeps the city, the watchmen watch in vain.
127.2: It is vain for you to rise up early, to come home late, to eat the bread of sorrows, because he shall give his beloved sleep.
127.3: Behold, sons are a heritage of the LORD, and the fruit of the womb is to be desired.
127.4: As arrows in the hand of a mighty man, so are the young men.
127.5: Happy is the man that has filled his quiver with them: he shall not be ashamed when he speaks with the enemies in the gate.

128.1: Blessed is every one that fears the LORD, that walks in his ways.
128.2: When thou shalt eat the labour of thine hands; happy shalt thou be, and it shall be well with thee.
128.3: Thy wife shall be as a fruitful vine by the sides of thy house; thy children like olive plants round about thy table.
128.4: Behold, that thus shall the man be blessed that fears the LORD.
128.5: The LORD shall bless thee out of Zion, and thou shalt see the good of Jerusalem all the days of thy life.
128.6: Yea, thou shalt see thy children’s children and peace upon Israel.

129.1: Many a time have they afflicted me from my youth, may Israel now say:
129.2: Many a time have they afflicted me from my youth; yet they have not prevailed against me.
129.3: The plowers plowed upon my back; they made long their furrows.
129.4: The LORD is righteous; he has cut asunder the cords of the wicked.
129.5: All those that hate Zion shall all be confounded and turned back.
129.6: They shall be as the grass upon the housetops, which withers before it grows up,
129.7: with which the reaper does not fill his hand nor he that binds sheaves his bosom.
129.8: Neither did those who go by say, The blessing of the LORD be upon you; we bless you in the name of the LORD.

130.1: Out of the depths I cry unto thee, O LORD.
130.2: Lord, hear my voice; let thine ears be attentive to the voice of my supplications.
130.3: If thou, O LORD, should mark iniquities, O Lord, who shall endure?
130.4: Therefore there is forgiveness close to thee, that thou may be feared.
130.5: I have waited for the LORD, my soul has waited, and for his word I have waited.
130.6: My soul has waited for the Lord more than those that watch for the morning: I say, more than those that watch for the morning.
130.7: Let Israel wait for the LORD; for with the LORD there is mercy and plenteous redemption close to him.
130.8: And he shall ransom Israel from all his sins.

131.1: LORD, my heart has not become haughty, nor mine eyes lofty; neither have I walked in grandeur, nor in wonderful things above and beyond that which pertains to me.
131.2: Rather I have quieted myself and caused my soul to become silent, that I might be as a child that is weaned of his mother, as one who is weaned from my own life.
131.3: Let Israel wait for the LORD from now on and for ever.

132.1: LORD, remember David and all his afflictions:
132.2: How he swore unto the LORD and vowed unto the mighty God of Jacob;
132.3: surely I will not come into the habitation of my house nor go up into my bed,
132.4: I will not give sleep to my eyes or slumber to my eyelids,
132.5: until I find out a place for the LORD, a habitation for the mighty God of Jacob.
132.6: Behold, we heard of her in Ephratah; we found her in the fields of the wood.
132.7: We will go into his tents; we will worship at his footstool.
132.8: Arise, O LORD, into thy rest; thou, and the ark of thy strength.
132.9: Thy priests are clothed with righteousness, and thy merciful ones shout for joy.
132.10: For the love of thy slave David, do not turn away thy face from thine anointed.
132.11: The LORD has sworn truth unto David; he will not turn from it; Of the fruit of thy body I will set upon thy throne.
132.12: If thy sons will keep my covenant and my testimony that I shall teach them, their sons shall also sit upon thy throne for ever.
132.13: For the LORD has chosen Zion; he has desired her for his habitation.
132.14: This shall be my rest for ever; here I will dwell; for I have desired her.
132.15: I will abundantly bless her provision; I will satisfy her poor with bread.
132.16: I will also clothe her priests with saving health, and her merciful ones shall shout aloud for joy.
132.17: There will I make the horn of David to bud; I have ordained a lamp for my anointed.
132.18: His enemies I will clothe with shame, but upon himself shall his crown blossom.

133.1: Behold, how good and how pleasant it is for brethren to dwell together in unity!
133.2: It is like the precious ointment upon the head, that runs down upon the beard, even Aaron’s beard, that goes down to the skirts of his garments;
133.3: as the dew of Hermon, that descends upon the mountains of Zion; for there the LORD commands blessing and eternal life.

134.1: Behold, bless ye the LORD, all ye slaves of the LORD, who by night stand in the house of the LORD.
134.2: Lift up your hands in the sanctuary, and bless the LORD.
134.3: The LORD that made the heavens and the earth bless thee out of Zion.

135.1: Halelu-JAH. Praise ye the name of the LORD; praise him, O ye slaves of the LORD.
135.2: Ye that stand in the house of the LORD, in the courts of the house of our God,
135.3: praise JAH; for the LORD is good; sing praises unto his name; for it is pleasant.
135.4: For JAH has chosen Jacob unto himself and Israel for his own possession.
135.5: For I know that the LORD is great and that our Lord is above all gods.
135.6: Whatever the LORD desired, he did in the heavens and in the earth, in the seas and in all the deep places.
135.7: He who causes the clouds to ascend from the ends of the earth, made the lightnings in the rain; he who brings the winds out of his treasuries.
135.8: He who smote the firstborn of Egypt, both of man and beast;
135.9: sent signs and wonders into the midst of thee, O Egypt, upon Pharaoh, and upon all his slaves.
135.10: He who smote many Gentiles and slew mighty kings,
135.11: Sihon king of the Amorites and Og king of Bashan, and all the kingdoms of Canaan
135.12: gave their land for a heritage, a heritage unto Israel his people.
135.13: Thy name, O LORD, is eternal, and thy memorial, O LORD, from generation to generation.
135.14: For the LORD will judge his people, and he will repent himself concerning his slaves.
135.15: The idols of the Gentiles are silver and gold, the work of men’s hands.
135.16: They have a mouth, but they do not speak; they have eyes, but they do not see;
135.17: they have ears, but they do not hear; neither is there any spirit in their mouths.
135.18: Let those that make them become like unto them and every one that trusts in them.
135.19: Bless the LORD, O house of Israel; bless the LORD, O house of Aaron:
135.20: Bless the LORD, O house of Levi; ye that fear the LORD, bless the LORD.
135.21: Blessed be the LORD out of Zion who dwells at Jerusalem. Halelu-JAH.

136.1: O give thanks unto the LORD, for he is good; for his mercy endures for ever.
136.2: O give thanks unto the God of gods, for his mercy endures for ever.
136.3: O give thanks to the Lord of lords: for his mercy endures for ever.
136.4: To the only one who does great wonders: for his mercy endures for ever.
136.5: To him that by intelligence made the heavens: for his mercy endures for ever.
136.6: To him that stretched out the earth above the waters: for his mercy endures for ever.
136.7: To him that made the great lights: for his mercy endures for ever:
136.8: The sun to rule in the day: for his mercy endures for ever:
136.9: The moon and stars to rule in the night: for his mercy endures for ever.
136.10: To him that smote Egypt in their firstborn: for his mercy endures for ever:
136.11: And brought out Israel from among them: for his mercy endures for ever:
136.12: With a strong hand and with a stretched out arm: for his mercy endures for ever.
136.13: To him who divided the Red Sea into parts: for his mercy endures for ever:
136.14: And made Israel to pass through the midst of it: for his mercy endures for ever:
136.15: But overthrew Pharaoh and his host in the Red Sea: for his mercy endures for ever.
136.16: To him who led his people through the wilderness: for his mercy endures for ever.
136.17: To him who smote great kings: for his mercy endures for ever.
136.18: And slew powerful kings: for his mercy endures for ever,
136.19: Sihon king of the Amorites: for his mercy endures for ever:
136.20: And Og the king of Bashan: for his mercy endures for ever:
136.21: And gave their land for an inheritance: for his mercy endures for ever:
136.22: Even an inheritance unto Israel his slave: for his mercy endures for ever.
136.23: Who remembered us in our low estate: for his mercy endures for ever:
136.24: And has redeemed us from our enemies: for his mercy endures for ever.
136.25: Who gives food to all flesh: for his mercy endures for ever.
136.26: O give thanks unto the God of the heavens: for his mercy endures for ever.

137.1: By the rivers of Babylon, there we sat down, yea, we wept, when we remembered Zion.
137.2: We hanged our harps upon the willows in the midst thereof;
137.3: when there, those that carried us away captive asked us for the words of the song; with our harps of joy hung upon the willows saying, Sing us one of the songs of Zion.
137.4: How shall we sing the song of the LORD in the land of strangers?
137.5: If I forget thee, O Jerusalem, my right hand shall be forgotten.
137.6: If I do not remember thee, my tongue shall cleave to the roof of my mouth; if I do not prefer to lift up Jerusalem as my chief joy.
137.7: Remember, O LORD, the sons of Edom in the day of Jerusalem; who said, Raze it, raze it, even to the foundation thereof.
137.8: O daughter of Babylon, who art to be destroyed; happy shall he be, that rewards thee as thou hast served us.
137.9: Happy shall he be, that takes and dashes thy offspring against the stones.

138.1: I will praise thee with my whole heart: before the gods I will sing praises unto thee.
138.2: I will worship the temple of thy holiness and praise thy name above thy mercy and thy truth; for thou hast made thy name to be magnificent and raised up thy spoken word above all things.
138.3: In the day when I called, thou didst answer me and strengthen me with strength in my soul.
138.4: All the kings of the earth shall praise thee, O LORD, when they hearken unto the spoken words from thy mouth.
138.5: Yea, they shall sing in the ways of the LORD: for great is the glory of the LORD.
138.6: For the LORD, who is high and lifted up, looks upon the humble, but the proud he does not know.
138.7: Though I walk in the midst of trouble, thou wilt revive me; thou shalt stretch forth thy hand against the wrath of my enemies, and thy right hand shall save me.
138.8: The LORD will perfect that which concerns me; thy mercy, O LORD, endures for ever; forsake not the works of thine own hands.

139.1: O LORD, thou hast searched me and known me.
139.2: Thou knowest my sitting down and my rising up, thou dost understand my thoughts from afar.
139.3: Thou hast girded my walk and my rest, and hast prepared all my ways.
139.4: For the word is not even upon my tongue, and, behold, O LORD, thou dost know it altogether.
139.5: Thou hast formed my face and my insides and laid thine hand upon me.
139.6: Thy knowledge is wonderful beyond my ability to comprehend; it is high, I cannot understand it.
139.7: Where shall I go from thy spirit? or where shall I flee from thy presence?
139.8: If I ascend to the heavens, thou art there: if I make my bed in Sheol, behold, thou art there.
139.9: If I take the wings of the dawn and dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea,
139.10: even there shall thy hand lead me, and thy right hand shall hold me.
139.11: If I say, Surely the darkness shall cover me; even the night shall shine because of me.
139.12: Even the darkness does not hide from thee; but the night shines as the day; the darkness is as the light.
139.13: For thou hast possessed my kidneys: thou hast covered me in my mother’s womb.
139.14: I will praise thee; for I am fearfully and wonderfully made; marvellous are thy works, and that, my soul knows right well.
139.15: My body was not hid from thee, even though I was made in secret and brought together in the lowest parts of the earth.
139.16: Thine eyes did see my substance yet being imperfect; and in thy book all my members were written, which were then formed, without lacking one of them.
139.17: Therefore, how precious are thy thoughts unto me, O God! How great is the sum of them!
139.18: If I should count them, they are more in number than the sand; when I awake, I am still with thee.
139.19: Surely thou wilt slay the wicked, O God; depart from me therefore, ye bloodthirsty men.
139.20: For they speak against thee wickedly, and thine enemies take thy name in vain.
139.21: Do I not hate all those, O LORD, that hate thee? and am not I grieved with those that rise up against thee?
139.22: I hate them with perfect hatred; I count them mine enemies.
139.23: Search me, O God, and know my heart; try me and know my thoughts
139.24: and see if there be any wicked way in me, and lead me in the way eternal.

140.1: Deliver me, O LORD, from the evil man; preserve me from the man of violence.
140.2: Who devise evil in their heart; they are continually gathered together for war.
140.3: They have sharpened their tongue like a serpent; adders’ poison is under their lips. Selah.
140.4: Keep me, O LORD, from the hands of the wicked; preserve me from the man of violence, who have purposed to overthrow my steps.
140.5: The proud have hid a snare for me and cords; they have spread a net; on the path they have set snares for me. Selah.
140.6: I said unto the LORD, Thou art my God: hear the voice of my supplications, O LORD.
140.7: O GOD the Lord, the strength of my saving health, cover thou my head in the day of battle.
140.8: Grant not, O LORD, the desires of the wicked; do not further his wicked thought lest they exalt themselves. Selah.
140.9: As for the head of those that compass me about, let the perversion of their own lips cover them.
140.10: Let burning coals fall upon them; let them be cast into the fire, into deep pits, that they not rise up again.
140.11: The man with an evil tongue shall not be established in the earth; evil shall hunt the man of violence to overthrow him.
140.12: I know that the LORD will effect the judgment of the poor and the judgment of the destitute.
140.13: Surely the righteous shall give thanks unto thy name; the upright shall dwell in thy presence.

141.1: LORD, I have called unto thee: make haste unto me; give ear unto my voice, when I cry unto thee.
141.2: Let my prayer be set forth before thee as incense, the gift of my hands as the evening sacrifice.
141.3: Set a watch, O LORD, upon my mouth; keep the door of my lips.
141.4: Incline not my heart to any evil thing, to do works with ungodliness with the men that work iniquity, and let me not eat of their dainties.
141.5: Let the righteous smite me in mercy, and let him reprove me: and let not a flattering evil prince anoint my head, for my prayer shall ever be against his evil.
141.6: Their judges shall be thrown down from strong places; they shall hearken unto my words; for they are sweet.
141.7: Our bones are scattered at the mouth of Sheol, as when one cuts and cleaves wood upon the earth.
141.8: Therefore mine eyes look unto thee, O GOD the Lord; in thee is my trust; leave not my soul destitute.
141.9: Keep me from the hands of the snare which they have laid for me, and from the snares of the workers of iniquity.
141.10: Let the wicked fall together into their own nets, whilst I pass on ahead forever.

142.1: I shall cry unto the LORD with my voice; with my voice shall I ask the LORD for mercy.
142.2: I shall pour out my complaint before him; before him I shall tell of my trouble.
142.3: When my spirit was overwhelmed within me, then thou didst know my path. In the way in which I walked have they secretly laid a snare for me.
142.4: I looked on my right hand, and beheld, but there was no one that would know me; I had no refuge; no one cared for my soul.
142.5: I cried unto thee, O LORD; I said, Thou art my hope and my portion in the land of the living.
142.6: Attend unto my cry, for I am brought very low; deliver me from my persecutors; for they are stronger than I.
142.7: Bring my soul out of prison, that I may praise thy name; the righteous shall feast with me; when thou shalt have weaned me.

143.1: Hear my prayer, O LORD; give ear to my supplications for the sake of thy truth; answer me for the sake of thy righteousness.
143.2: And enter not into judgment with thy slave; for in thy sight shall no man living be justified.
143.3: For the enemy has persecuted my soul; he has smitten my life down to the ground; he has made me to dwell in darkness, as those that have been long dead.
143.4: Therefore my spirit has become overwhelmed within me; my heart within me has become desolate.
143.5: I remembered the days of old; I meditated on all thy works; I mused on the work of thy hands.
143.6: I stretched forth my hands unto thee; my soul thirsted after thee, as a thirsty land. Selah.
143.7: Hear me speedily, O LORD; my spirit fails; hide not thy face from me lest I be like those that go down into the grave.
143.8: Cause me to hear thy mercy in the morning, for in thee do I trust; cause me to know the way in which I should walk, for I lift up my soul unto thee.
143.9: Deliver me, O LORD, from my enemies; I flee unto thee.
143.10: Teach me to do thy will, for thou art my God. Let thy good Spirit lead me into the land of uprightness.
143.11: By thy name, O LORD, thou shalt give me life; by thy righteousness thou shalt bring my soul out of trouble.
143.12: And by thy mercy thou shalt scatter my enemies and destroy all the adversaries of my soul; for I am thy slave.

144.1: Blessed be the LORD my strength, who trains my hands for the battle and my fingers for the war:
144.2: My mercy and my fortress; my high tower and my deliverer; my shield and he in whom I trust, who subdues my people under me.
144.3: LORD, what is man that thou knowest him? or the son of man, that thou esteemeth him?
144.4: Man is like unto vanity; his days are as a shadow that passes away.
144.5: Bow thy heavens, O LORD, and come down; touch the mountains, and they shall smoke.
144.6: Cast forth lightning and scatter them; shoot out thine arrows and destroy them.
144.7: Send thine hand from above; redeem me and deliver me out of many waters, from the hand of the strange sons,
144.8: whose mouth speaks vanity, and their right hand is a right hand of falsehood.
144.9: I will sing a new song unto thee, O God; upon a psaltery and an instrument of ten strings I will sing praises unto thee.
144.10: Thou, he who gives salvation unto kings, who redeems David his slave from the evil sword.
144.11: Redeem me, and save me from the hand of strange sons, whose mouth speaks vanity, and their right hand is a right hand of falsehood:
144.12: That our sons may be as plants grown up in their youth; that our daughters may be as corner stones, polished after the similitude of a palace;
144.13: that our garners may be full, affording all manner of store; that our sheep may bring forth thousands and ten thousands in our streets;
144.14: that our oxen may be strong to labour; that there be no breaking in nor going out; that there be no shout of alarm in our streets.
144.15: Blessed is that people, that is in such a case; yea, blessed is that people, whose God is the LORD.

145.1: I will extol thee, my God, my king, and I will bless thy name for ever and ever.
145.2: Each day will I bless thee, and I will praise thy name for ever and ever.
145.3: Great is the LORD and greatly to be praised, and his greatness is unsearchable.
145.4: One generation shall praise thy works to another and shall declare thy mighty acts.
145.5: I will speak of the beauty of the glory of thy majesty and of thy wondrous works.
145.6: And men shall speak of the might of thy terrible acts, and I will declare thy greatness.
145.7: They shall proclaim the memory of thy great goodness and shall sing of thy righteousness.
145.8: The LORD is gracious and full of compassion, slow to anger and of great mercy.
145.9: The LORD is good to all; and his tender mercies shine over all his works.
145.10: Let all thy works praise thee, O LORD, and thy merciful ones bless thee.
145.11: They speak of the glory of thy kingdom and talk of thy power,
145.12: to make known to the sons of Adam his mighty acts and the glory of the magnificence of his kingdom.
145.13: Thy kingdom is a kingdom of all ages, and thy dominion endures throughout all generations.
145.14: The LORD upholds all that fall and raises up all those that are oppressed.
145.15: The eyes of all wait upon thee, and thou givest them their food in due season.
145.16: Thou dost open thine hand and satisfy the desire of every living thing.
145.17: The LORD is righteous in all his ways and merciful in all his works.
145.18: The LORD is near unto all those that call upon him, to all that call upon him in truth.
145.19: He will fulfil the desire of those that fear him; he also will hear their cry and will save them.
145.20: The LORD preserves all those that love him, but all the wicked he will destroy.
145.21: My mouth shall speak the praise of the LORD, and let all flesh bless his holy name for ever and ever.

146.1: Halelu-JAH. Praise the LORD, O my soul.
146.2: In my life I will praise the LORD; I will sing praises unto my God while I live.
146.3: Put not your trust in princes, nor in the son of man in whom there is no salvation.
146.4: His spirit shall go forth, he shall return to his earth; in that very day all his thoughts shall perish.
146.5: Happy is he who has the God of Jacob for his help, whose hope is in the LORD his God;
146.6: who made the heavens and the earth, the sea and all that is therein; who keeps truth for ever:
146.7: He who does justice unto the oppressed; who gives bread to the hungry. The LORD looses the prisoners:
146.8: The LORD opens the eyes of the blind; the LORD raises those that are bowed down; the LORD loves the righteous:
146.9: The LORD preserves the strangers; he raises up the fatherless and widow; but the way of the wicked he turns upside down.
146.10: The LORD shall reign for ever, even thy God, O Zion, from generation to generation. Halelu-JAH.

147.1: Halelu-JAH: for it is good to sing praises unto our God; for praise is pleasant and beautiful.
147.2: The LORD, he who builds up Jerusalem; shall gather together the outcasts of Israel.
147.3: He heals the broken hearted, and he binds up their wounds.
147.4: He counts the number of the stars and calls them all by their names.
147.5: Great is our Lord and of great power; his intelligence is infinite.
147.6: The LORD lifts up the humble; he casts the wicked down to the earth.
147.7: Sing unto the LORD with thanksgiving; sing praise upon the harp unto our God:
147.8: Who covers the heavens with clouds, who prepares the rain for the earth, who makes grass to grow upon the mountains.
147.9: He who gives the beast his food and to the sons of the ravens which cry unto him.
147.10: He does not delight in the strength of the horse; nor does he take pleasure in the legs of a man.
147.11: The LORD takes pleasure in those that fear him, in those that wait upon his mercy.
147.12: Praise the LORD, O Jerusalem; praise thy God, O Zion.
147.13: For he has strengthened the bars of thy gates; he has blessed thy sons within thee.
147.14: He who makes peace to be thy borders shall fill thee with the finest of the wheat.
147.15: He sends forth his word upon earth; his word runs very swiftly.
147.16: He who gives snow like wool scatters the hoarfrost like ashes.
147.17: He casts forth his ice like morsels; who can stand before his cold?
147.18: He shall send forth his word and melt them; his wind shall blow, and the waters shall flow.
147.19: He declares his words unto Jacob, his statutes and his judgments unto Israel.
147.20: He has not dealt so with the other nations, which have not known his judgments. Halelu-JAH.

148.1: Halelu-JAH. Praise ye the LORD from the heavens; praise him in the heights.
148.2: Praise ye him, all his angels; praise ye him, all his hosts.
148.3: Praise ye him, sun and moon; praise him, all ye stars of light.
148.4: Praise him, ye heavens of heavens and ye waters that are above the heavens.
148.5: Let them praise the name of the LORD; for he commanded, and they were created.
148.6: He has established them for ever and ever: he has made a law which shall not be broken.
148.7: Praise the LORD from the earth, ye dragons and all deeps,
148.8: fire and hail; snow and vapour; stormy wind fulfilling his word,
148.9: mountains and all hills; fruitful trees and all cedars,
148.10: beasts and all animals; creeping things and flying fowl,
148.11: kings of the earth and all the peoples, princes and all judges of the earth,
148.12: both young men and maidens, the old with the children,
148.13: Let them praise the name of the LORD; for his name alone is excellent; his glory is above earth and heavens.
148.14: has exalted the horn of his people; let all his merciful ones praise him; even of the sons of Israel, the people near unto him. Halelu-JAH.

149.1: Halelu-JAH. Sing unto the LORD a new song, let his praise be in the congregation of the merciful.
149.2: Let Israel rejoice with his Maker; let the sons of Zion be joyful with their King.
149.3: Let them praise his name in the dance; let them sing praises unto him with the timbrel and harp.
149.4: For the LORD takes pleasure in his people; he will beautify the humble with saving health.
149.5: The merciful shall be joyful with glory; they shall sing aloud upon their beds.
149.6: The high praises of God shall be in their mouth and a two-edged sword in their hand,
149.7: to execute vengeance upon the Gentiles and punishments upon the peoples,
149.8: to imprison their kings with fetters and their nobles with chains of iron,
149.9: to execute upon them the judgment written: this shall be glory for all his merciful ones. Halelu-JAH.

150.1: Halelu-JAH. Praise God in his sanctuary; praise him in the firmament of his power.
150.2: Praise him for his mighty acts; praise him according to his excellent greatness.
150.3: Praise him with the sound of the shofar; praise him with the psaltery and harp.
150.4: Praise him with the timbrel and dance; praise him with stringed instruments and organs.
150.5: Praise him upon the loud cymbals; praise him upon the cymbals of joy.
150.6: Let every thing that has breath praise JAH. Halelu-JAH.
